body.name: Ten Ways to Get Dumped by a Tyrant: Volume III (Light Novel)
body.description: Can she trust him with her heart?Scarlett knows that Charlemagne is a tyrant with a cruel and unpredictable streak, but now she also knows his tender and passionate side. As she rises to the helm of House Arman, enemies surface that wish to destroy her and everything she holds dear. Now, Scarlett must use her wit and courage to outsmart them and protect her people.But when she learns a shocking secret about Charlemagne’s past, she comes to a crossroads: will she stay or will she go? Find out in the thrilling third installment of Ten Ways to Get Dumped by a Tyrant.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I couldn't stop laughing
reviews.reviewText: I do feel like there was a chunk of the book missing between book two and book 3. I actually went back and looked at book two to make sure I hadn't forgotten something only to realize there really are missing chapters of information. Once I got over that, I just moved on with the story like it didn't matter. And I guess it really didn't matter... And there's a lot of hand waving over those missing months worth of time in the book. I think the author might have been just bored with that arc. The stuff she did get to is quite great though. I couldn't stop laughing, the characters are delightful. I do hate the sudden ending cliffhanger though. It almost feels like it ended mid-sentence. I almost feel like recommending waiting for book four before you start reading this one... But then again it was really good and if people all wait for book four book for might never come out right?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Brilliant. Absolutely brilliant!! I am in love/obsessed with this series. It is funny, loving, adventurous, crazy, and our MC's are brilliant. They are finally on the same page, yet have misunderstood each other which is driving the secondary characters to go crazy. I am so happy how they wrote in the OG FL and how true love breaks spells. Some truths will come to light and we get more scenes of the fairies which I absolutely love.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars declining in quality
reviews.reviewText: First book I loved, and second book I enjoyed. At this point, the plot feels very rushed. The pacing is extremely inconsistent, and the prolonging of romantic tension is absolutely absurd at this point and maintained only by a thread. Will definitely continue to the fourth book, but this one is a mess.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 11, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Honestly I would have loved it if they actually went through the arc of them being stuck inside the book. But it apparently didn’t made the cut and died a sad death.Yet they always reference the book they transmigrated and did things that us reader don’t know about. And how the ML builds his relationship with Scarlet inside the book that we still don’t know about 😠It’s tasteless.Besides that, we finally see Scarlett realize she has romantic feelings for the ML and how she dealt the baron. OG female lead finally makes an appearance. And we see our main characters flirting.In short, it’s still an interesting tale but we no longer get the comedic tone as we did in the first volume. Author skipping a whole arc that showed character development as well a new character (the cleric) that was with them in the arc she skip 🤦🏽‍♀️Welp until the next volume, I guess
